name: Superflight
description: This extension allows the user to apply a behavior an any object, that when enabled, will be able to fly.
-change the maximum speed, and the acceleration/deceleration of the flight
-make the object do a jump-up when flight begins
-use built-in expressions that check the flight stats

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Enabling this behaviour makes the object detach from the ground, and fly.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Flight

eventsFunctions.description: Fly to object to the left.
eventsFunctions.name: FlyLeft

eventsFunctions.description: Fly to object to the right.
eventsFunctions.name: FlyRight

eventsFunctions.description: Fly to object down.
eventsFunctions.name: FlyDown

eventsFunctions.description: Fly to object up.
eventsFunctions.name: FlyUp

eventsFunctions.description: Set object's horizontal acceleration and deceleration.
eventsFunctions.name: SetXacc
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set horizontal flight acceleration and deceleration of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ (_PARAM1_)

eventsFunctions.description: Set object's vertical acceleration and deceleration.
eventsFunctions.name: SetYacc
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set vertical flight acceleration and deceleration of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ (_PARAM1_)

eventsFunctions.description: Set object's maximum horizontal speed.
eventsFunctions.name: SetMaxXspeed
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set maximum horizontal flight speed of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ (_PARAM1_)

eventsFunctions.description: Set object's maximum vertical speed.
eventsFunctions.name: SetMaxYspeed
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set maximum vertical flight speed of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ (_PARAM1_)

eventsFunctions.description: Set the speed at which the object jumps up when flight begins.
eventsFunctions.name: SetJumpUpSpeed
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the flight's jump up speed of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ (_PARAM1_)

eventsFunctions.description: Set whether the object jumps up or not when flight begins.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Set the ability of jumping up when flight begins
eventsFunctions.name: SetJumpUpAbility
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the jump-up ability of _PARAM0_ when flight begins: _PARAM2_ (_PARAM1)

eventsFunctions.description: Set the maximum distance of floating when object is not actively flying.
eventsFunctions.name: SetFloatingDistance
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set maximum flight floating distance of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ (_PARAM1_)

eventsFunctions.description: Set the speed of bobbing when object is not actively flying.
eventsFunctions.name: SetFloatingSpeed
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set flight bobbing speed of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ (_PARAM1_)

eventsFunctions.description: Set whether the object bobs when in a still place, or not.
eventsFunctions.name: SetFloatingAbility
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set bobbing ability of _PARAM0_ when inactively flying: _PARAM2_ (_PARAM1_)

eventsFunctions.description: Set the speed value where active and inactive motion is considered.
eventsFunctions.name: SetSpeedCutoffValue
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set flight speed cutoff value of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ (_PARAM1_)

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is flying.
eventsFunctions.name: Moving_

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object can bob when not moving.
eventsFunctions.name: Floating_

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object can float.
eventsFunctions.name: CanFloat_

eventsFunctions.description: Does the object jump up a little bit when flight is started?.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Does the object jump up at start?
eventsFunctions.name: JumpUpAtStart_
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM0_ jumps up when flight is started (_PARAM1_)

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the direction of flight vertically. If up: -1. If down: 1.
eventsFunctions.name: FlightYDir

events.comment: I just noticed that there exists a "Sign of number" function that does just exactly what I have written below. Oh well.

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the direction of flight horizontally. If left: -1. If right: 1.
eventsFunctions.name: FlightXDir

eventsFunctions.description: The flight's horizontal acceleration and deceleration.
eventsFunctions.name: FlightXacc

eventsFunctions.description: The flight's vertical acceleration and deceleration.
eventsFunctions.name: FlightYacc

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the maximum allowed horizontal flight speed.
eventsFunctions.name: FlightMaxXspeed

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the maximum allowed vertical flight speed.
eventsFunctions.name: FlightMaxYspeed

eventsFunctions.description: Maximum allowed floating distance.
eventsFunctions.name: FloatDist

eventsFunctions.description: Floating speed.
eventsFunctions.name: FloatSpeed

eventsFunctions.description: The number that clearly disguises a border between halted and active movement.
eventsFunctions.name: MotionCutoff

eventsFunctions.description: The speed of the jump-up action.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Speed of jumping up at start
eventsFunctions.name: StartJumpUpSpeed

events.comment: Bobbing the object when not moving
The flight state variables need to be cleared, because if the flight is still going, then they are going to be set again (thus, they are not changing). If it is not going, then the flight is over.

propertyDescriptors.label: Horizontal acceleration and deceleration
propertyDescriptors.description: The higher the value, the slower the acceleration is.
propertyDescriptors.name: AccelerationAndDecelerationX

propertyDescriptors.label: Vertical acceleration and deceleration
propertyDescriptors.description: The higher the value, the slower the acceleration is.
propertyDescriptors.name: AccelerationAndDecelerationY

propertyDescriptors.label: Does it float when not moving?
propertyDescriptors.description: If in a still place, enabling this property makes the object float in a sinusodial pattern.
propertyDescriptors.name: FloatingWhenPassive

propertyDescriptors.label: Floating distance
propertyDescriptors.description: Approximated maximum number of pixels away from the player center, when floating. The more you type in, the less precise it gets. ("a")
propertyDescriptors.name: FloatingMagnitude

propertyDescriptors.label: Can collide with platforms?
propertyDescriptors.description: If enabled, then any object with an active "Platform" behaviour can stop the flying object.
propertyDescriptors.name: CollisionWithPlatforms

propertyDescriptors.label: Motion cutoff value
propertyDescriptors.description: This number means the clear border between passive (stop) and active movement. If you don't have to, do not really fiddle with this.
propertyDescriptors.name: MotionCutoff

propertyDescriptors.label: Does it jump up at start?
propertyDescriptors.description: It makes the object jump up when flight is begun.
propertyDescriptors.name: JumpWhenStart

propertyDescriptors.label: The speed of jumping up
propertyDescriptors.description: This is a momentary speed, which is not conserved. The higher the number, the smaller the speed is.
propertyDescriptors.name: JumpHeightAtStart

propertyDescriptors.label: Old Y position of the object
propertyDescriptors.name: __Superflight_FlightOldYpos2

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: An object that can completely stop a flying object. Incompatible with the gDevelop's built-in "Platform" behaviour.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FlightPlatform
